title: Interactive Development Exploration
description: A collaboration with the City of Boston's Housing Innovation Lab, producing a webapp for exploring development scenarios through interactive lessons, that visualizes how planning policies impact housing affordability, neighborhood character, and feasibility.

blocks.value: The webapp presents four lesson-modules that explore aspects of housing production. Each lesson contains information about a specific topic in planning & development regulation, and then allows users to explore the implications of those regulations in a 3D visualization.

The lessons start with the basics of planning regulations, then dive into how budgets and affordability intersect, trade-offs of parking requirements, and how policies for compact apartments affect affordability. In the final module, users can mix and match all variables to explore real-world development trade-offs, from cost and feasibility to building size and affordability.
Visit the webapp to explore the lessons and visualizations here: [Understanding Housing Development: An Interactive Educational Toolkit](https://placeful.github.io/housingilab/)
